title: Relative Clauses
instructions: Fill in the gaps with the relative pronouns.

remarks: corr: which. After a preposition, do not use 'that'.
corr: which. 'what' should follow a verb.

sentence: spoke about these problems were convincing.
remarks: corr: who. 'which' is used with inanimate objects.
corr: who. 'what' should follow a verb.

sentence: was standing in front of the house was mine.
remarks: corr: which. We cannot omit the rel. pronoun because it's the subject of the rel. clause
corr: which. 'what' can follow only a verb.

sentence: I opened the can cannot be used any more.
remarks: corr: which. There's a preposition (with), so we need a rel. pronoun after it.
corr: which. 'what' can follow a verb.
